instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.C1802: What is C1802? Capacitor to ground on PCH_SRTCRST_L on machines from 2009-2012, PCH_SRTCRST_L needs to be high for PCH to not be in RTC reset mode, this capacitor can become corroded or leaky and result in this signal being pulled low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
I have no other dc board to test but I have another working 3209 board and it works with customer dc board. So it is not DC BOARD.
I am confused what to do next as one wire circuite is not on main board.

I checked ACOK pin 14 <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and it is 3.3V
PPBUS - 8.39V
Board is no liquide damage. Pretty clean. Customer told me one day stoped working. I heated SMC a little but no change.
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> - 3.3V

What more to check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
LIO conector on the board?
Check the pins and traces...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: Got 3V on center pin of charger on the LIO board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: Now I have green light, but still not power.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: Voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> now that green light is on???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: PPBUS voltage? Voltage on L7260? Voltage on <CAPACITOR>C1802</CAPACITOR>/03?
